file.name: splunk.yaml
file.content:
components:
  schemas:
    tmp1:
      properties:
        failure_count: {type: string}
        message: {type: string}
        success: {type: string}
        success_count: {type: string}
      type: object
    tmp2:
      properties:
        entry_author_name: {type: string}
        entry_content: {type: string}
        entry_title: {type: string}
        entry_updated: {type: string}
        id: {type: string}
        messages: {type: string}
      type: object
    tmp3:
      properties:
        _bkt: {type: string}
        _cd: {type: string}
        _indextime: {type: string}
        _raw: {type: string}
        _serial: {type: string}
        _sourcetype: {type: string}
        _time: {type: string}
        host: {type: string}
        index: {type: string}
        linecount: {type: string}
        source: {type: string}
        sourcetype: {type: string}
        splunk_server: {type: string}
      type: object
    tmp4:
      properties:
        json_results: {type: string}
        results_length: {type: string}
        searchresults: {type: string}
      type: object
    tmp5:
      properties:
        success: {type: string}
      type: object
  securitySchemes:
    BasicAuth: {scheme: basic, type: http}
info:
  contact: {email: frikky@shuffler.io, name: '@frikkylikeme', url: 'https://twitter.com/frikkylikeme'}
  description: Automated generation of Splunk Splunk
  title: Splunk Splunk
  version: 1.0.0
  x-logo: data:image/png;base64,
openapi: 3.0.2
paths:
  tmp0:
    post:
      description: Search, monitor, and analyze machine-generated big data.
      parameters:
      - description: The human-readable name of a saved search.
        example: Errors in the last hour
        in: query
        name: Search
        required: true
        schema: {type: string}
      - description: The report owner's Splunk username
        example: admin
        in: query
        name: Owner
        required: false
        schema: {type: string}
      - description: The Splunk app name that the saved report resides in
        example: Recent Events
        in: query
        name: App
        required: false
        schema: {type: string}
      - description: Maximum number of minutes into the past to query events
        example: '60'
        in: body
        name: Since
        required: false
        schema: {type: string}
      responses:
        '200': {description: Successful request}
      summary: Splunk Data
  tmp1:
    post:
      description: Edit Notable Events in Splunk
      parameters:
      - description: A comma seperated list of notable event IDs. Must be provided
          if a searchID is not provided. Include multiples of this attribute to edit
          multiple events.
        example: 29439FBC-FFCB-45FF-93C2-420202012E1E,38439BBC-EECB-44FF-91C2-420121A12E12
        in: query
        name: Rule UIDs
        required: false
        schema: {type: string}
      - description: An ID of a search. All of the events associated with this search
          will be modified unless a list of ruleUIDs are provided that limit the scope
          to a subset of the results.
        example: ''
        in: query
        name: Search ID
        required: false
        schema: {type: string}
      - description: An owner. Only required if reassigning the event.
        example: ''
        in: query
        name: New Owner
        required: false
        schema: {type: string}
      - description: An urgency. Only required if you are changing the urgency of
          the event.
        example: ''
        in: query
        name: Urgency
        required: false
        schema: {type: string}
      - description: A status ID matching a status in reviewstatuses.conf. Only required
          if you are changing the status of the event.
        example: ''
        in: query
        name: Status
        required: false
        schema: {type: string}
      - description: A description of the change or some information about the notable
          events.
        example: ''
        in: query
        name: Comment
        required: false
        schema: {type: string}
      responses:
        '200':
          content:
            application/json:
              schema: {$ref: '#/components/schemas/tmp1'}
          description: Successful request
      summary: Splunk Edit Notable Events
  tmp2:
    post:
      description: Get a saved search from Splunk
      parameters:
      - description: Name of the saved search
        example: MySavedSearch
        in: query
        name: Saved Search Name
        required: true
        schema: {type: string}
      responses:
        '200':
          content:
            application/json:
              schema: {$ref: '#/components/schemas/tmp2'}
          description: Successful request
      summary: Splunk Get Saved Search
  tmp3:
    post:
      description: Perform splunk one-shot searches and return the results into Swimlane
        records
      parameters:
      - description: Splunk Search Query
        example: 123.123.123.123 | head 5
        in: query
        name: Search String
        required: true
        schema: {type: string}
      - description: If True 'search' will be removed from the prefix of the Search
          Query, false will leave the 'search' prefix. Defaults to 'False'.
        example: 'True'
        in: query
        name: Remove Search
        required: true
        schema: {type: boolean}
      - description: Earliest time modifier. If time modifiers are included in the
          search string, these values will be overridden
        example: -24h
        in: query
        name: Earliest Time
        required: true
        schema: {type: string}
      - description: Latest time modifier. If time modifiers are included in the search
          string, these values will be overridden
        example: Now
        in: query
        name: Latest Time
        required: true
        schema: {type: string}
      responses:
        '200':
          content:
            application/json:
              schema: {$ref: '#/components/schemas/tmp3'}
          description: Successful request
      summary: Splunk One-shot Search
  tmp4:
    post:
      description: Perform splunk one-shot searches and return the results into Swimlane
        records as raw HTML
      parameters:
      - description: Splunk Search Query
        example: 123.123.123.123 | head 5
        in: query
        name: Search String
        required: true
        schema: {type: string}
      - description: Earliest time modifier. If time modifiers are included in the
          search string, these values will be overridden
        example: -24h
        in: query
        name: Earliest Time
        required: true
        schema: {type: string}
      - description: Latest time modifier. If time modifiers are included in the search
          string, these values will be overridden
        example: Now
        in: query
        name: Latest Time
        required: true
        schema: {type: string}
      responses:
        '200':
          content:
            application/json:
              schema: {$ref: '#/components/schemas/tmp4'}
          description: Successful request
      summary: Splunk One-shot Search (HTML)
  tmp5:
    post:
      description: Write an event to index in Splunk
      parameters:
      - description: The index name to write event to, defaults to 'default'
        example: shadow
        in: query
        name: Index
        required: false
        schema: {type: string}
      - description: Raw event text to be passed into the index.
        example: Sun Jul 10 15:56:02 PDT 2011 User myusername logged in successfully.
        in: query
        name: Raw Text Event
        required: true
        schema: {type: string}
      - description: The value to populate in the host field for events from this
          data input.
        example: deafultHost
        in: query
        name: Host
        required: false
        schema: {type: string}
      - description: The source value to fill in the metadata for this input's events.
        example: www
        in: query
        name: Source
        required: false
        schema: {type: string}
      - description: The sourcetype to apply to events from this input.
        example: web_event
        in: query
        name: Source Type
        required: false
        schema: {type: string}
      responses:
        '200':
          content:
            application/json:
              schema: {$ref: '#/components/schemas/tmp5'}
          description: Successful request
      summary: Splunk Write Event To Index
tags:
- {name: SIEM & Log Management}

Error: parse: parse spec: parse operations: paths: tmp4: post: parse path "tmp4": path MUST begin with a forward slash
